protocols.description: A set of strings representing HTTP protocols.

project_id.description: GCP Project ID for the GCP Model Armor subscription.

location_id.description: GCP Location ID for the GCP Model Armor subscription.

template_id.description: GCP Model Armor Template ID to enforce.

enable_multi_language_detection.description: Enables multi-language detection mode. Must be used with 'source_language'.

source_language.description: Source language (ISO code) to use when 'enable_multi_language_detection' is enabled.

stop_on_error.description: Stop processing if an error occurs.

timeout.description: Connection timeout with the GCP Model Armor service

guarding_mode.description: The guardrail mode to use for the request

reveal_failure_categories.description: Whether to reveal failure categories in the response to the caller.

request_failure_message.description: The message to return when a failure occurs on the request phase.
request_failure_message.default: Request was filtered by GCP Model Armor

response_failure_message.description: The message to return when a failure occurs on the response phase.
response_failure_message.default: Response was filtered by GCP Model Armor

response_buffer_size.description: The amount of bytes receiving from upstream to be buffered before sending to the model armor service. This only applies to the response content guard.

text_source.description: Select where to pick the 'text' for the GCP Model Armor Services request.

gcp_use_service_account.description: Use service account auth for GCP-based providers and models.

gcp_service_account_json.description: Set this field to the full JSON of the GCP service account to authenticate, if required. If null (and gcp_use_service_account is true), Kong will attempt to read from environment variable `GCP_SERVICE_ACCOUNT` or from the instance/container metadata service.
